captions.text:
HI IM ALEX FARNHAM AND THIS IS ANIMALIST NEWS!
SO A NEW DINOSAUR HAS BEEN DISCOVERED IN PORTUGAL,

AND IT MAY BE THE LARGEST LAND PREDATOR EVER
DISCOVERED IN EUROPE.

TORVOSAURUS GURNEYI, WHICH COULD REACH 10
METERS LONG, AND WEIGH ABOUT 4-5 TONS, HAD

LARGE BLADE SHAPED TEETH, WHICH SUGGESTS THAT
IT WAS AT THE TOP OF THE FOOD CHAIN IN IT’S

REGION ROUGHLY 150 MILLION YEARS AGO.
WHEN FIRST DISCOVERING THE BONES OF THIS DINOSAUR,

SCIENTISTS THOUGHT IT WAS A SPECIES FROM NORTH
AMERICA KNOWN AS TORVOSAURUS TANNERI. AFTER

A CLOSER COMPARISON, THEY REALIZED THAT THEIR
MOUTH BONES HAVE A DIFFERENT STRUCTURE, AND

THAT THE SPECIES HAD LESS THAN 11 TEETH, WHILE
ITS RELATIVE HAD MORE.

NOW THIS ISN’T THE LARGEST PREDATORY DINOSAUR
EVER DISCOVERED.

THERE WERE MUCH LARGER SPECIES INCLUDING TYRANNOSAURUS,
GIGANOTOSAURUS, AND SPINOSAURUS. HOWEVER,

T. GURNEYI WAS ONE OF THE LARGEST LAND CARNIVORES
OF ITS TIME, AND WAS DEFINITELY A FIERCE PREDATOR

SO WHAT’S YOUR FAVORITE PREDATORY DINOSAUR?
HOW ABOUT YOUR FAVORITE DINOSAUR OVERALL?

LET US KNOW IN THE COMMENTS BELOW.
BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THESE VIDEOS HERE, SUBSCRIBE

UP HERE, AND I’LL SEE YOU HAIRY MAMMALS
LATER.
